FuncDef:
The hdlc dampening disable command disables HDLC link dampening.
The undo hdlc dampening disable command restores HDLC link dampening.
By default, HDLC link dampening is enabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Optical fiber flapping on a physical interface causes HDLC link to flap between Up and Down frequently. This results in unstable link or network layers. To resolve this issue, configure the HDLC dampening function.
This function enables HDLC link dampening on an interface. Therefore, if the HDLC link flapping occurs, stability of the entire link layer and network layer can be guaranteed. If you do not want to use the HDLC link dampening function, run the hdlc dampening disable command to disable the function.
